com.microsoft.azure.iothub.transport.https

Class HttpsTransport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.iothub.transport.https.HttpsTransport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IotHubTransport

    public final class HttpsTransport
extends Object
implements IotHubTransport

    An HTTPS transport. Contains functionality for adding messages and sending batched messages to an IoT Hub. Buffers unsent messages until they are received by an IoT Hub. A transport is bound at construction to the following parameters: IoT Hub name, device ID, device key, and message valid seconds.

    The transport can also poll an IoT Hub for messages and invoke a user-defined message callback if a message and callback is found.

      • open

        public void open()
          throws IOException
        Establishes a communication channel with an IoT Hub. If a channel is already open, the function shall do nothing.
        Specified by:
        open in interface IotHubTransport
        Throws:
        IOException - if a communication channel cannot be established.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes all resources used to communicate with an IoT Hub. Once close() is called, the transport is no longer usable. If the transport is already closed, the function shall do nothing.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IotHubTransport
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs in closing the transport.

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage()
                   throws IOException

        Invokes the message callback if a message is found and responds to the IoT Hub on how the processed message should be handled by the IoT Hub.

        If no message callback is set, the function will do nothing.
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface IotHubTransport
        Throws:
        IOException - if the server could not be reached, or if the response from sending the IoT Hub message result does not have status code IotHubStatusCode.OK_EMPTY.
        IllegalStateException - if the transport has not been opened or is already closed.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the transport has no more messages to handle, and false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface IotHubTransport
        Returns:
        true if the transport has no more messages to handle, and false otherwise.

      • moveWaitingListToInProgressList

        protected void moveWaitingListToInProgressList()
        Moves as many messages as can be sent in one HTTPS request from the waiting list to the in-progress list. If a single message is moved to the in-progress list, this indicates that the message is to be sent in the un-batched message format.

      • inProgressListToMessage

        protected HttpsMessage inProgressListToMessage()
                                        throws SizeLimitExceededException
        Generates the message, possibly batched, to be sent using the messages in the in-progress list.
        Returns:
        the message to be sent.
        Throws:
        SizeLimitExceededException - if the messages in inProgressList exceed the service-bound message size limit of 255 kb.
        NoSuchElementException - if inProgressList is empty.

      • moveInProgressListToCallbackList

        protected void moveInProgressListToCallbackList(IotHubStatusCode status)
        Moves messages from the in progress list to the callback list, updating the message packets with the status code from the response.
        Parameters:
        status - the status code returned by the IoT Hub.
